title: UKBORDERS (Geographic Data Unit): services for supporting geographic data for learning, teaching and research.
abstractText:
UKBORDERS is a web based service, available online 24/7, delivering geospatial digital boundary data to the UK academic community. An extensive library of geospatial digital boundary data and associated look-up tables (covering, among others, the key 1971, 1981, 1991 and 2001 censuses) is curated on behalf of and delivered to the academic community by UKBORDERS.

Dedicated facilities provide access to the data in either a pre-packaged format (Easy Download) or via a dynamic, user driven interface (Boundary Data Selector). Additionally, access to current and historical postcode directories (1980 to present) is provided by the Postcode Directory Download facility. Each facility has bespoke on-line help with off-line support provided by the EDINA helpdesk.

The focus of activities for the current award period will revolve around four key areas:

  1. Ongoing support for the service, its continuity and maintenance;
  2. Service enhancements and research investigations into innovative data delivery technologies to support end users;
  3. User support, outreach and training;
  4. Engagement and coordination with the wider Census Programme.
